props.name: Fireplace poker
props.desc: Poking the coal or wood fuel in the fireplace helps the fire breathe, poking someone in the heart has the exact opposite effect.

props.name: Umbrella Stand
props.desc: A cylindrical object holding umbrellas and walking sticks. Umbrella stands don't kill people; swords, clubs, and cane gun in the umbrella stands do.

props.name: Curtain Rope
props.desc: Used for holding the curtain on one side in the morning and strangling people on the other side in the afternoon.

props.name: Globe
props.desc: A raised-relief globe in gold. i.e. a golden globe.

props.name: Bust
props.desc: A bronze bust of Dysh the Great (one of the most unknown writers of the 18th century).

props.name: Servant's Dining Table
props.desc: Servant's dining table because they are too poor to use normal dining tables.

props.name: Chef's knife
props.desc: A heavy duty knife used for cutting, chopping, and slicing bones and meat and people.

props.name: Bottle of Wine
props.desc: A vintage red wine bottle. It's so vintage and potent that even a shot glass of it can knock you out. The whole bottle will kill you... if bashed against your head.

props.name: Cutlery Set
props.desc: A set of silver cutlery. As your mom probably have mentioned, never run with a knife or a fork or both unless you want to accidentally stab someone in the heart.

props.name: Flower Pot
props.desc: A big flower pot standing in the corner of the room looking pretty.

props.name: Curtain Rope
props.desc: Used for holding the curtain on one side in the morning and strangling people in the afternoon.

props.name: Scented Candle
props.desc: A candle that emits scents. One might think it's useless but half of the earth's population may disagree.

props.name: Razor
props.desc: An old straight razor (a.k.a cut-throat razor) used mainly for shaving and occasionally for cutting throats.

agents.name: Comrade Tartar
agents.desc: A Russia circus acrobat defected to England. A muscled and strong man that claims he has captured all the circus's bears barehanded

agents.name: Colonel Worcestershire
agents.desc: An old British military man. Though respected and feared by his men, old age has left visible marks on his body.

agents.name: Don Gravy
agents.desc: An American mobster on a business trip in England. Famous for never missing a shot or a meal.

agents.name: Mademoiselle Veloute
agents.desc: A French super model on holidays.

agents.name: Madame Bechamel
agents.desc: A middle-aged French woman. Poor soul was widowed five times and every time only a week after her wedding.

agents.name: Mr. Hollandaise
agents.desc: The butler. A Dutch and French descendant butler and maid husband and wife

agents.name: Herr Duckefett
agents.desc: A German explorer. HAs a strange taste when it comes to women

agents.name: Signor Bolognese
agents.desc: Italian, sleezy, barber, slim, fast, cheap
